benchmark_details.name: Synthetic Textbook Forget Sets
benchmark_details.overview: This work presents a scalable, automated approach to generate high-quality forget sets using language models for the purpose of unlearning sensitive knowledge in large language models. The generated synthetic datasets are evaluated against expert-curated sets and baseline alternatives.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a method for constructing synthetic forget sets to facilitate the unlearning of sensitive knowledge from language models.

data.source: Generated using a large language model with structured prompting.

methodology.calculation: Unlearn utility computed as a trade-off between forgetting performance and retention of general capabilities.
methodology.interpretation: Higher unlearn utility indicates more effective unlearning with preserved general capabilities.
methodology.baseline_results: Evaluated against expert-curated and baseline synthetic datasets.
methodology.validation: Results validated through comparative experiments against baseline unlearning methods.
